arts.ttl: Frank Lampard reveals the two things he demanded at half time to spark Coventry City comeback
arts.sum: The Sky Blues were awful in the first half when they conceded early from the Bluebirds’ first attack amid poor passing and defending before the game turned on its head in the first few minutes of the second when Tatsuhiro Sakamoto scored the equaliser before the home side were reduced to ten men when Callum Robinson was sent off with a straight red card for an elbow to Bobby Thomas’s face. Commenting on the turning point of the game when City scored and Cardiff lost a man shortly after, Lampard said: “Yeah, it does, you know, and you want to play and you’re grateful for the opportunity at that point – because I think it was a red card – to play against ten men.

arts.ttl: Omer Riza says 'moment got to him' after Cardiff City red card flips Coventry City game on head
arts.sum: The Bluebirds boss spoke after the 1-1 draw with Coventry City

arts.ttl: Cardiff City 1-1 Coventry City: 10-man Bluebirds cling on for point after Callum Robinson red card
arts.sum: Taatsuhiro Sakamoto netted the leveller seconds after the restart before Callum Robinson was given his marching orders a minute later for connecting with Bobby Thomas's face with an elbow. Cardiff City began 2025 with a whirlwind clash against Coventry City which saw them reduced to 10 men and cling on for a point despite a second-half onslaught from the visitors.

arts.ttl: Stoke appoint ex-Coventry boss Robins as manager
arts.sum: Stoke City appoint former Coventry boss Mark Robins as their new manager on a three-and-a-half-year deal.

arts.ttl: Tatsuhiro Sakamoto earns point for Coventry at 10-man Cardiff
arts.sum: Alex Robertson had put the hosts ahead.

Substitute Ollie Tanner came close to restoring the lead for City, finding himself behind the Coventry defence and one-on-one with Oliver Dovin, but the keeper was equal to the effort and pushed it behind for a corner. City went into the break with a deserved lead, but concededafter the restart after Sakamoto tapped home from close-range after Alnwick came out to initially deny Ellis Simms .

arts.ttl: Coventry City player ratings after 1-1 draw at ten man Cardiff City
arts.sum: City dominated the remainder of the half, making the extra man advantage count but struggled to find a way past Jak Aknwick in goal, with Sheaf, Torp and Simms all denied by saves, while Oliver Dovin played his part at the other end, denying Ollie Tanner a winner. Callum O’Dowda beat Bobby Thomas on the left wing before sending in a cross which was uncontested, allowing Cian Ashford to head back across the goal to Alex Robertson who steered the ball over he line in a sequence of really poor collective defending.

arts.ttl: Cardiff City v Coventry City match paused amid confusion as stadium announcer asks fans for help
arts.sum: The match at Cardiff City Stadium was paused for five minutes

arts.ttl: Frank Lampard has named his Coventry City team to face Cardiff on New Year's Day
arts.sum: City: Oliver Dovin; Milan Van Ewijk, Bobby Thomas, Joel Latibeaudiere, Jake Bidwell; Josh Eccles, Ben Sheaf; Tatsuhiro Sakamoto, Victor Torp, Jack Rudoni; Ellis Simms. Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group.

arts.ttl: Cardiff City v Coventry City live updates and team news as Frank Lampard's men begin 2025
arts.sum: Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group. Stay tuned for all today's team news which will be published here at 2pm, an hour before kick-off, followed by live updates from the match from Sky Blues reporter Andy Turner.
